title: Q1 - Fundamentals of Propulsion
desc: Short quiz on fundamentals of propulsion.

mc.questionText: Which component converts high-pressure gas into a directed high-velocity jet to produce thrust?
Specific impulse in rocketry is most commonly reported in which unit?

tf.questionText: For a chemical rocket with constant exhaust velocity, increasing mass flow rate increases thrust.
For the same engine, specific impulse is usually lower in vacuum than at sea level.

fib.questionText: The chamber pressure is usually denoted by ____ in rocket equations.
Effective exhaust velocity equals specific impulse multiplied by ____.

title: Q2 - Rocket Engine Types
desc: Short quiz on rocket engine types.

mc.questionText: Which engine class uses a solid grain that contains both fuel and oxidizer?
Which propulsion type accelerates ions using electric fields to achieve very high specific impulse?

tf.questionText: A hybrid rocket typically uses a solid fuel with a separate liquid oxidizer.
In bipropellant liquid engines, fuel and oxidizer are stored in a single combined tank.

fib.questionText: Cold-gas thrusters expel stored ____ through a nozzle.
Hall-effect thrusters accelerate charged ____ to produce thrust.

mc.questionText: RP-1 used in many launch vehicles is best described as highly refined what?
The acronym LOX stands for liquid what?

tf.questionText: Changing the oxidizer-to-fuel mixture ratio can significantly affect specific impulse.
A monopropellant system requires two separate reactant tanks for operation.

fib.questionText: The mixture ratio is often written as O/____ in propulsion texts.
Hydrazine is commonly used as a ____propellant in many spacecraft thrusters.

title: Q4 - Thrust & Specific Impulse
desc: Short quiz on thrust & specific impulse.

mc.questionText: Which symbol is standard for specific impulse in rocketry literature?
For the same nozzle, specific impulse generally increases when the engine operates in which environment?

tf.questionText: For a fixed exhaust velocity, doubling the propellant mass flow rate approximately doubles the thrust.
Specific impulse is defined as thrust divided by weight flow rate of the propellant.

fib.questionText: The effective exhaust velocity is often denoted by ____ in equations.
Specific impulse in SI units is measured in ____.

mc.questionText: During choked flow, what is the Mach number at the nozzle throat approximately?
At sea level, an overexpanded nozzle typically contains what kind of shock relative to the flow?

tf.questionText: Increasing the nozzle area ratio tends to lower exit static pressure for a given chamber pressure.
A diffuser and a nozzle are functionally identical flow devices.

fib.questionText: A bell nozzle is designed to reduce ____ losses while shortening length.
Supersonic flow corresponds to Mach numbers greater than ____.

mc.questionText: What term commonly describes high-frequency combustion instabilities in rocket chambers?
Baffles and resonators are installed primarily to improve which aspect of combustion?

tf.questionText: Low-frequency chamber oscillations are often modeled as Helmholtz modes.
Severe combustion instability generally improves specific impulse.

fib.questionText: Acoustic waves propagate at the local speed of ____ in the gas.
Adding damping reduces oscillation ____ in unstable systems.

mc.questionText: In regenerative cooling, which working fluid is typically circulated through wall channels as the primary coolant?
Ablative liners protect the chamber by sacrificing surface material that primarily does what?

tf.questionText: Film cooling works by injecting a thin layer of cooler fluid along the hot wall.
Regenerative cooling circuits are typically routed only through the injector faceplate.

fib.questionText: Heat flows spontaneously from hot regions to ____ regions.
Longitudinal coolant channels are machined into the chamber ____.

mc.questionText: In a gas generator cycle, the turbopump is driven using high-energy products from what source?
A main pump for liquid propellants commonly uses which impeller type to achieve high speed?

tf.questionText: Seal systems in turbopumps are critical for minimizing leakage between stages.
An inducer upstream of the main impeller is used to reduce cavitation risk.

fib.questionText: Cavitation involves the formation of ____ bubbles in low-pressure regions.
Rotational speed is commonly expressed in ____ for turbomachinery specifications.

mc.questionText: A spark‑torch ignition system initiates combustion using which triggering method with a small torch flame?
TEA‑TEB ignition fluid is best described as which type of pair that ignites on contact with oxygen?

tf.questionText: Pyrotechnic igniters are generally single‑use devices intended for reliable starts.
Hypergolic propellants require an external spark to begin reacting.

fib.questionText: Engine start sequences are designed to avoid a hard ____ event.
Reliable ignition timing prevents chamber pressure ____ during startup.

mc.questionText: What is the term for vapor formation at a turbopump inlet that causes performance loss?
Repeated thermal cycling can initiate which material degradation in hot‑section components?

tf.questionText: Sensor redundancy and voting logic are used to increase fault tolerance in engines.
Adding redundant systems generally increases overall risk of mission failure.

fib.questionText: An automated shutdown in response to a detected fault is an engine ____.
Thermal protection systems limit component ____ during high‑heat events.

mc.questionText: Which variable decreases when flow speed increases in an inviscid, incompressible stream (per Bernoulli)?
The non-dimensional ratio of inertial to viscous forces in a flow is the ____ number.

tf.questionText: For steady incompressible flow through a constant-area duct, the mass flow rate is uniform along the duct.
Static pressure always equals total pressure in moving air.

fib.questionText: Continuity states that A·V remains ____ for steady incompressible flow in a duct.
The vector field describing local flow velocity is commonly denoted by ____.

mc.questionText: Which condition typically triggers transition from laminar to turbulent boundary layer on a flat plate?
The thin region near a surface where viscous effects are important is called the ____ layer.

tf.questionText: A turbulent boundary layer generally has a fuller velocity profile than a laminar one.
Skin-friction drag on a smooth plate is usually lower in turbulent flow than in laminar flow at the same Reynolds number.

fib.questionText: The dimensionless wall distance used in turbulence modeling is written as y____.
Boundary layer thickness is often denoted by the Greek letter ____.

mc.questionText: Bernoulli’s equation applies along a streamline for flows that are steady, incompressible, and have negligible ____.
The continuity equation enforces conservation of ____ in a fluid.

tf.questionText: Static pressure plus dynamic pressure equals total pressure in Bernoulli’s relation.
Bernoulli’s equation is valid through normal shocks without modification.

fib.questionText: Dynamic pressure is written as q = 1/2 ρ ____^2.
For incompressible flow, density ρ is treated as ____.

mc.questionText: The coefficient that multiplies dynamic pressure and wing area to give the lift force is C____.
Induced drag primarily results from the generation of lift and is strongest at ____ speeds.

tf.questionText: Profile drag includes both skin-friction and form drag components.
For a given wing, increasing angle of attack indefinitely will always increase lift without stall.

fib.questionText: The lift force acts roughly ____ to the freestream in small-angle analysis.
Drag force is commonly decomposed into induced and ____ components.

mc.questionText: The Mach number is defined as flow speed divided by local speed of ____.
Isentropic area–Mach relations link area ratio to Mach for a ____ gas.

tf.questionText: In subsonic converging nozzles, the throat flow becomes choked when Mach number reaches one.
For ideal isentropic flow, total temperature decreases through a frictionless nozzle expansion.

fib.questionText: The ratio of specific heats is usually denoted by the Greek letter ____.
Compressibility effects become important when M exceeds about ____.

mc.questionText: Across a normal shock, the Mach number downstream becomes ____ than one.
An oblique shock is commonly characterized by a shock angle relative to the upstream ____.

tf.questionText: Static pressure rises across a normal shock.
Total pressure is exactly conserved across a shock wave.

fib.questionText: The downstream region of separated subsonic recirculation behind a shock is called a ____.
Shock polar diagrams plot pressure ratio versus ____ angle.

mc.questionText: Adverse pressure gradient most directly promotes boundary layer ____ from a surface.
Vortex generators are small devices added to delay ____ on wings.

tf.questionText: Flow separation can increase pressure drag significantly.
A favorable pressure gradient tends to cause earlier separation.

fib.questionText: The point where the wall shear stress becomes zero is near the separation ____.
Reattaching separated shear layers form a closed ____ region.

mc.questionText: Which quantity is often used to describe energy distribution across scales in turbulence?
The time-averaging approach that splits variables into mean and fluctuating parts is called ____ decomposition.

tf.questionText: Turbulent flows exhibit irregular, three-dimensional fluctuations over a wide range of scales.
The Kolmogorov microscales correspond to the largest energy-containing eddies.

fib.questionText: The turbulent kinetic energy per unit mass is commonly abbreviated as ____.
The dissipation rate in k–ε models is denoted by the Greek letter ____.

title: Q9 - Reynolds Number Applications
desc: Short quiz on reynolds number applications.

mc.questionText: At low Reynolds numbers, flow around small particles is dominated by which force type?
Pipe flow transitions from laminar to turbulent at Re of roughly ____.

tf.questionText: For geometrically similar flows, matching Reynolds number helps match viscous effects.
In external aerodynamics, Reynolds number has no influence on drag coefficients.

fib.questionText: Stokes flow corresponds to Re much ____ than one.
Wind tunnel models often use trip dots to promote early ____.

title: Q10 - Wind Tunnel Data
desc: Short quiz on wind tunnel data.

mc.questionText: The measured force components in a typical wind tunnel balance are lift, drag, and ____.
Blocking effects at high model blockage ratios are corrected using ____ corrections.

tf.questionText: Dynamic pressure is computed from test-section density and velocity measurements.
Angle of attack is the angle between the chord line and the wind tunnel floor.

fib.questionText: Pitot‑static tubes measure total and ____ pressure.
Data are often non‑dimensionalized using reference area and chord ____.

mc.questionText: Which subsystem provides electrical power generation and storage for a spacecraft?
Which subsystem maintains spacecraft internal temperatures within allowable limits?

tf.questionText: The communications subsystem handles both uplink commands and downlink telemetry.
The attitude control subsystem is unrelated to pointing accuracy of instruments.

fib.questionText: The bus that houses common spacecraft services is often called the ____.
The subsystem responsible for determining spacecraft orientation is abbreviated ____.

mc.questionText: Which test verifies that subsystems operate together according to end-to-end requirements?
The interface control document primarily defines mechanical, electrical, and software ____.

tf.questionText: Hardware-in-the-loop setups allow software validation with real avionics in the loop.
Mass, power, and data are typical system budgets tracked during integration.

fib.questionText: A formal review prior to environmental testing is the system ____ review.
The combined spacecraft plus launch vehicle is referred to as the integrated ____.

mc.questionText: Which storage device is commonly used to supply power during eclipses?
Photovoltaic arrays generate electrical power from incident ____.

tf.questionText: State of charge indicates the remaining capacity of a battery as a percentage.
A power conditioning and distribution unit regulates and routes electrical power to loads.

fib.questionText: The ratio of output power to input solar power is called array ____.
Batteries degrade over repeated charge and ____ cycles.

mc.questionText: Which passive device radiates heat to space to maintain component temperatures?
Multi‑layer insulation primarily reduces heat transfer by ____.

tf.questionText: Thermal straps can conduct heat from hot components to radiators.
Blanket heaters are used to cool electronics during safe mode.

fib.questionText: Thermal models often balance absorbed and emitted ____.
Temperature control deadbands keep values within specified ____.

mc.questionText: Which sensor measures the spacecraft’s rotation rate directly?
A star tracker determines attitude by matching observed stars to an onboard ____.

tf.questionText: Quaternion math is commonly used to avoid singularities in attitude representation.
Reaction wheels provide torques to control attitude without expelling propellant.

fib.questionText: The extended ____ filter is widely used for attitude estimation.
Three‑axis stabilized spacecraft maintain fixed orientation in all three ____.

mc.questionText: Which subsystem component shapes and directs RF energy for links to ground?
High‑rate missions often use modulation schemes such as QPSK to encode ____.

tf.questionText: Link budget analysis accounts for gains, losses, and noise to ensure adequate margin.
S‑band is typically at a higher frequency than Ka‑band.

fib.questionText: Forward path from ground to spacecraft is called the ____ link.
Receiver sensitivity is often specified in units of carrier‑to‑____ ratio.

mc.questionText: Which analysis checks that the spacecraft structure survives launch loads?
A motorized device used to deploy solar arrays is a type of ____.

tf.questionText: Modal testing is used to identify natural frequencies and damping.
Mechanical deployment mechanisms must be single‑point failure tolerant when feasible.

fib.questionText: Finite element models discretize structures into small ____.
Hold‑down and release devices prevent motion until commanded ____.

title: Q8 - Command & Data Handling
desc: Short quiz on command & data handling.

mc.questionText: Which onboard computer function sequences time‑tagged activities and controls subsystems?
Telemetry packets encapsulate housekeeping and science ____ for downlink.

tf.questionText: Redundant processors and cross‑strapping can improve CDH fault tolerance.
A real‑time operating system typically schedules tasks with deterministic timing.

fib.questionText: Non‑volatile storage for long‑term data is usually called ____ memory.
Time synchronization often relies on a spacecraft master ____.

mc.questionText: Which propulsion type uses electric fields to accelerate ions for high specific impulse?
A monopropellant thruster decomposes a single fluid over a ____.

tf.questionText: Bipropellant systems require separate tanks for fuel and oxidizer.
Cold‑gas thrusters typically provide higher specific impulse than LOX/LH2 engines.

fib.questionText: Thrust is approximately mass flow rate times exhaust ____.
Tank pressure regulation often uses a high‑pressure ____ gas.

mc.questionText: Which team function plans and uploads command sequences for upcoming passes?
During anomaly response, the first priority is to place the spacecraft in a safe ____.

tf.questionText: Ground stations schedule visibility windows based on predicted passes.
Telemetry trending helps detect off‑nominal behavior over time.

fib.questionText: A pre‑pass briefing confirms station status and pass ____.
Post‑pass analysis checks data completeness and link ____.

mc.questionText: Which prefix indicates three carbon atoms in a straight chain?
In IUPAC names, the main chain suffix for a simple alkane is ____.

tf.questionText: The lowest set of locants is used to number substituents in IUPAC names.
In IUPAC nomenclature, substituents are listed in descending order of length, not alphabetically.

fib.questionText: A substituent derived from methane is called ____ group.
A saturated hydrocarbon with no rings is an ____.

mc.questionText: Which labels specify absolute configuration at a chiral center?
Stereoisomers related as non‑superimposable mirror images are called ____.

tf.questionText: CIP priority is assigned by atomic number at the point of difference.
A meso compound has optical rotation equal to zero due to internal symmetry.

fib.questionText: Rotation of polarized light is measured by a ____ polarimeter.
Double‑bond stereochemistry is often labeled ____/trans.

mc.questionText: Compounds with the same formula but different connectivity are ____ isomers.
Interconversion by rotation about single bonds relates different ____.

tf.questionText: Diastereomers are stereoisomers that are not mirror images.
Enantiomers always have identical physical properties in achiral environments.

fib.questionText: Isomers differing only at one stereocenter are called ____.
The ratio of isomers at equilibrium is the ____ ratio.

mc.questionText: A curved arrow represents movement of a pair of ____.
An intermediate with an unpaired electron is a ____.

tf.questionText: Rate‑determining step is the slowest elementary step in a mechanism.
Reaction coordinate diagrams plot energy versus time only.

fib.questionText: A positively charged carbon species is a ____.
A species that donates an electron pair is a ____.

title: Q5 - SN1 vs SN2
desc: Short quiz on sn1 vs sn2.

mc.questionText: SN1 reactions proceed through a planar ____ intermediate.
Bimolecular substitution with backside attack best describes ____.

tf.questionText: Tertiary substrates usually favor SN1 over SN2.
Polar aprotic solvents commonly favor SN1 pathways.

fib.questionText: SN2 reactions invert configuration via ____ inversion.
Leaving group ability often correlates with weak ____ bases.

mc.questionText: Unimolecular elimination proceeds via the same carbocation as ____.
In E2, the preferred geometric requirement is ____ periplanar.

tf.questionText: Strong bulky bases often favor Hofmann elimination products.
E1 and E2 mechanisms both require a strong base in the rate law.

fib.questionText: Zaitsev rule favors formation of the more substituted ____.
E2 occurs in a single ____ step.

mc.questionText: The IR region around 1700 cm⁻¹ is characteristic of a carbonyl ____.
¹H NMR splitting follows the n+1 rule where n is the number of neighboring ____.

tf.questionText: Downfield ¹H NMR signals correspond to more deshielded protons.
In mass spectrometry, the base peak is always the molecular ion.

fib.questionText: Chemical shift in ¹H NMR is reported in ____.
Strong broad IR absorption near 3300 cm⁻¹ often indicates an ____ group.

mc.questionText: The IR region around 1700 cm⁻¹ is characteristic of a carbonyl ____.
¹H NMR splitting follows the n+1 rule where n is the number of neighboring ____.

tf.questionText: Downfield ¹H NMR signals correspond to more deshielded protons.
In mass spectrometry, the base peak is always the molecular ion.

fib.questionText: Chemical shift in ¹H NMR is reported in ____.
Strong broad IR absorption near 3300 cm⁻¹ often indicates an ____ group.

mc.questionText: Aromatic rings follow Hückel’s rule with ____ π electrons.
Planar cyclic conjugation leads to magnetic ring ____ in NMR.

tf.questionText: Benzene is aromatic because it has six π electrons and is planar.
Cyclooctatetraene is aromatic in its usual tub conformation.

fib.questionText: Substitution that retains aromaticity is called ____ substitution.
The heteroaromatic analogue of benzene with one nitrogen is ____.

mc.questionText: Carbocation stability generally increases from primary to tertiary due to ____ stabilization.
An allylic carbocation is stabilized by ____ delocalization.

tf.questionText: Vinyl carbocations are usually less stable than tertiary carbocations.
Resonance delocalization tends to destabilize carbocations.

fib.questionText: Electron‑releasing groups tend to ____ carbocations.
Aromatic ring substitution at the benzylic position stabilizes the ____.

mc.questionText: Which hybridization corresponds to approximately tetrahedral geometry?

tf.questionText: In molecular orbital theory, bonding orbitals are lower in energy than antibonding orbitals.

fib.questionText: The bond order equals (Nb−Na)/____.

title: Q2 - Transition Metal Chemistry
desc: Short quiz on transition metal chemistry.

mc.questionText: A ligand that donates two pairs to the same metal is ____.

tf.questionText: Chelate ligands typically increase complex stability.

fib.questionText: Ligands act as Lewis ____ toward metals.

title: Q3 - Crystal Field Theory
desc: Short quiz on crystal field theory.

mc.questionText: In an octahedral field, the higher‑energy set is ____.

tf.questionText: High‑spin complexes have more unpaired electrons than low‑spin complexes.

fib.questionText: The octahedral splitting parameter is often written as ____.

mc.questionText: Strong‑field ligands generally cause ____ splitting.

tf.questionText: π‑acceptor ligands can stabilize low oxidation state metals via backbonding.

fib.questionText: Bulky ligands can reduce unwanted ____.

mc.questionText: Spin‑allowed transitions obey the rule ΔS = ____.

tf.questionText: d–d transitions are Laporte forbidden in centrosymmetric complexes.

fib.questionText: The Racah parameter that measures inter‑electron repulsion is ____.

mc.questionText: During discharge, electrons flow from the ____ to the cathode.

tf.questionText: Galvanic cells have positive cell potentials under standard conditions.

fib.questionText: The Nernst equation uses the reaction quotient ____.

mc.questionText: Switching which ion is inside vs outside the coordination sphere is ____ isomerism.

tf.questionText: Linkage isomerism occurs when a ligand binds through different donor atoms.

fib.questionText: Mirror‑image pairs of chiral complexes are ____.

mc.questionText: The oxygen carrier in human blood is ____.

tf.questionText: Metalloenzymes often mediate redox chemistry at the metal center.

fib.questionText: Iron–sulfur clusters cycle between Fe²⁺ and Fe³⁺ ____.

mc.questionText: A ligand that binds through an alkene π bond is ____.

tf.questionText: The 18‑electron rule is a stability guideline for many complexes.

fib.questionText: CO often engages in metal‑to‑ligand ____ backbonding.

mc.questionText: Unpaired electrons lead to ____ magnetism.

tf.questionText: Low‑spin Fe²⁺ octahedral complexes can be diamagnetic.

fib.questionText: Spin‑only magnetic moment depends on the number of unpaired ____.

mc.questionText: At equilibrium, the reaction quotient equals the ____ constant.

tf.questionText: Le Chatelier's principle predicts system response to a small disturbance.

fib.questionText: For aA+bB⇌cC+dD, the constant K uses activities raised to their ____.

mc.questionText: IR spectroscopy primarily probes molecular ____ vibrations.

tf.questionText: A Raman‑active mode changes molecular polarizability.

fib.questionText: UV‑Vis absorption involves promotion of an ____.

mc.questionText: The law stating energy is conserved is the ____ law.

tf.questionText: The second law introduces entropy as a state function.

fib.questionText: Thermal equilibrium transitivity is the ____ law.

mc.questionText: The rule relating F,P,C at equilibrium is the ____ rule.

tf.questionText: On a phase diagram, the triple point has three phases in equilibrium.

fib.questionText: The liquid–vapor line ends at the critical ____.

title: Q5 - Gibbs Free Energy
desc: Short quiz on gibbs free energy.

mc.questionText: At constant T and P, a spontaneous process has ΔG less than ____.

tf.questionText: At equilibrium, ΔG for the overall process is approximately zero.

fib.questionText: The relation ΔG=ΔH−TΔ____ links energy and entropy.

mc.questionText: The rate law for a unimolecular elementary step is typically ____ order.

tf.questionText: The Arrhenius equation links rate constant to activation energy.

fib.questionText: The slope of ln k versus 1/T equals −Ea/____.

mc.questionText: Allowed measurement outcomes correspond to operator ____.

tf.questionText: The wavefunction is normalized so its total probability equals one.

fib.questionText: Time evolution is generated by the system ____.

mc.questionText: Combining atomic orbitals constructively forms a ____ orbital.

tf.questionText: HOMO denotes the highest occupied molecular orbital.

fib.questionText: A node is a surface where the wavefunction equals ____.

mc.questionText: In statistical mechanics, Z commonly denotes the ____ function.

tf.questionText: The Boltzmann factor is exp(−E/kT).

fib.questionText: Helmholtz free energy relates to Z via F=−kT ln ____.

mc.questionText: Entropy can be written S=k ln ____ for microstates W.

tf.questionText: Canonical ensemble holds temperature constant.

fib.questionText: The probability of state i is proportional to the Boltzmann ____.
